intro: Dysoxylum cochinchinense var. quocense, commonly known as the Vietnamese tamarind tree, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and yellowish-orange flowers. The tree produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to tamarind, containing a sour pulp surrounded by seeds. It is often found in lowland evergreen forests and is valued for its timber and fruit. The plant also has medicinal uses in traditional medicine practices.
